doc.after: Gertie the Dinosaur first appeared as part of McCay's vaudeville act in early 1914.[33] It also appeared in an extended edition for movie theaters towards the end of the year.[39] Dinosaurs were still new to the public imagination at the time of Gertie's release. Advertisements reflected this by trying to educate audiences: "According to science this monster once ruled this planetÂ ... Skeletons [are] now being unearthed measuring from 90 ft. to 160 ft. in length. An elephant should be a mouse beside Gertie."[40]
